intro: Nyctosma, commonly known as the nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Solanaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, often violet or purple flowers and typically have berries as their fruit. Nyctosma species are native to various regions across the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. They often thrive in moist, well-drained soils and prefer partial to full sunlight. Many species within this genus contain alkaloids, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
